description: From Gallic +‎ -ize, from Latin Gallicus (“of or relating to Gaul”) and used archaically in English in reference to modern France.

verbs.description: gallicize (third-person singular simple present gallicizes, present participle gallicizing, simple past and past participle gallicized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Synonym of frenchify, to make French or more French-like.
(intransitive) Synonym of frenchify, to become French or more French-like.
(transitive) To translate into the French language.
